data.meta_description: In the competitions of the University Sports Federation of Hong Kong (#USFHK) 2021-22 on 26 June, CUHK Men‚Äôs Tennis Team and Men‚Äôs Handball Team won the‚Ä¶
data.text:
The Belt and Road Alliance for Traditional Chinese Medicine initiated by CUHK will host the Presidents‚Äô Forum 2024 this Friday (August 16). It aims to bring together universities from Belt and Road countries, as well as mainland China, to engage in discussions on the modernisation and internationalisation of traditional medicine. Welcome to join the online meeting and participate in this grand event in the traditional Chinese medicine industry! Date: 16 August 2024 (Friday) Time: 9:15 a.m. to 4:15 p.m. Venue: LT1, Yasumoto International Academic Park, CUHK Online meeting: https://bit.ly/4dkIbVW (via ZOOM) Event details: https://bit.ly/3yplmBm #cuhk #thechineseuniversityofhongkong #BeltandRoad #ChineseMedicine #TraditionalMedicine

The 2024 CUHK Orientation Day has successfully concluded on 8 August! We are delighted that the new students joined together in this grand event üéâüéä Various themed lectures were held that day, allowing our freshmen to gain a deep understanding of CUHK's core values, career planning at university, mental health, etc. üìë In addition, our 9 colleges organised briefing sessions to showcase their unique features, educational philosophies, hostel and facilities information, scholarships and financial aid, as well as other student resources ‚ú® The orientation day has marked the beginning of a wonderful chapter for the new academic year. We warmly welcome the new students of the 2024-25 academic year to join #CUHK üëèüëè, embarking on a new journey in university life ü•≥üî• More on 2024 CUHK orientation information: https://bit.ly/3yqSs3P #CUHK #TheChineseUniversityofHongKong #UniversityOrientationDay #welcomeaboard #freshmen #studentdevelopment

CUHK and the Polar Research Institute of China (#PRIC) signed a Framework Agreement for Strategic Cooperation last Saturday (10 August) at a meeting of the China Symposium on Polar Science 2024. This collaboration will leverage the strengths of both parties to jointly promote the establishment of the Hong Kong Polar Science Innovation Centre, which will serve as a platform to connect Hong Kong with the Mainland and the global community in the fields of polar science and technological innovation. It also aims to support Hong Kong researchers in participating in polar observations, conducting cutting-edge scientific research, and developing innovative technologies. Details: https://bit.ly/4fILbNc #cuhk #thechineseuniversityofhongkong #CUHKResearch #PolarScience #Innovation

Congratulations to Professor Lai Hei-ming, Assistant Professor (Clinical) in the Department of Chemical Pathology from the Faculty of Medicine, and Professor Lyu Hairong, Vice-Chancellor Assistant Professor in the Department of Chemistry from the Faculty of Science, for being honoured with the 2024 Croucher Tak Wah Mak Innovation Awards by the Croucher Foundation in recognition of their excellent scientific research achievements! With the support of the Croucher Foundation, Professor Lai‚Äôs team will continue the research project ‚ÄúFrom spatial multi-omics to systems biophysics and 3D tissue diagnostics‚Äù, while Professor Lyu‚Äôs team will focus on the project ‚ÄúDeep involvement of boron into synthetic chemistry: methodologies and applications‚Äù, to advance boron chemistry and synthetic organic chemistry. Details: https://bit.ly/3LZqJdm CUHK Medicine CUHK Faculty of Science #cuhk #thechineseuniversityofhongkong #CUHKResearch #CUHKScholars #MedicineExcellence #PublicHealth

What do scholarship winners like about CUHK? Meet our stellar #scholarships winner Lazar, who is from Serbia and is currently pursuing a Ph.D. in Communication at #CUHK! ‚ÄúExciting‚Äù is the word Lazar uses to describe his life here. Tap the graphics to explore his inspiring story. We have also invited five other scholarship winners from diverse cultural backgrounds to share their CUHK experiences. Stay tuned! CUHK Graduate School #TheChineseUniversityofHongKong #ScholarshipWinner #PhDInCommunication #StudentLife #Inspiration #ScholarJourney #CampusLife

CUHK has always been distinguished as an icon for innovation and creativity, and we are excited to announce a milestone event in the realm of innovation and entrepreneurship! The CUHK Entrepreneur Day is celebrating its 10th Anniversary with an extraordinary exhibition that showcases over 20 pioneering projects from CUHK, highlighting the forefront of innovation in various fields. Attendees will also be able to engage in interactive games and participate in reels competition designed to inspire. We invite you to be part of this exciting event and explore how these innovations shape our future. Don't miss out on this unique opportunity to connect, learn, and experience the next wave of entrepreneurial spirit at CUHK! „ÄêCUHK Entrepreneur Day 10th Anniversary Innovation and Entrepreneurship Exhibition„Äë - Date: 22-28 August 2024 - Time: 4pm ‚Äì 8pm, 22 Aug; 11am ‚Äì 8pm, 23-28 Aug - Location: L1 Entrance Arena, New Town Plaza Phase 1, Shatin - Learn more: https://bit.ly/3yq3JBi #CUHK #TheChineseUniversityofHongKong #CUHKEntrepreneurDay #InnovationandEntrepreneurshipExhibition #Innovation #Entrepreneurship CUHK Alumni Affairs Office (CUHKAAO)

Professor Pan Jianwei was conferred the degree of Doctor of Science, honoris causa at the 93rd Congregation for the Conferment of Honorary Doctoral Degrees recently, in acknowledgment of his innovative scientific research and invaluable contributions to the nation and its people. Professor Pan has been examining quantum physics for two decades, he is the Executive Vice-President of the University of Science and Technology of China, and the Director of the Chinese Academy of Sciences‚Äô Center for Excellence in Quantum Information and Quantum Physics. As one of the pioneers in experimental research in quantum information, he has significant influence in the fields of quantum optics, quantum information, and quantum foundations. On 16 August 2016, the world‚Äôs first quantum satellite Quantum Experiments at Space Scale (QUESS), named Micius, was launched. Professor Pan once remarked "Micius is a great ancient scholar in optics, while the technologies our research team uses for quantum communication and quantum satellite are based on light or photons. Naming this quantum experimental satellite after Micius not only pays due respect to this prodigious ancient optical scientist but also demonstrates the self-confidence of our country in scientific research.‚Äú Citation of Professor Pan Jianwei: https://bit.ly/4feRw2W Learn more about the honorary doctorate awardees with CUHK in Focus: https://bit.ly/4cF5ae2 #CUHKHonoraryDoctorate #thechineseuniversityofhongkong #cuhk

CUHK researchers have won 11 #awards at the Silicon Valley International Inventions Festival (SVIIF) 2024, including five Gold Medalsü•áand three Silver Medalsü•à. Three of the winning inventions have also received #specialprizes, including the Prize of the International Federation of Inventors‚Äô Associations (IFIA), Prize of the United Inventors Association of America (UIA) and Prize of the China Association of Inventions (CAI). The awarded projects are examples of CUHK‚Äôs success in knowledge transfer, translating #research and #innovation into tangible benefits and outcomes. The #SVIIF brings together innovators from 40 countries and regions to showcase interesting inventions in the US. The festival was created to publicise state-of-the-art inventions from around the world and provide a unique opportunity for inventors to receive not only high-ranking international awards for their inventions but also to cultivate the American market in the heart of inventions, Silicon Valley. Details: https://bit.ly/3WvwbcL #CUHK #TheChineseUniversityofHongKong #CUHKResearch #ResearchExcellence

The Chinese University of Hong Kong, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, The University of Hong Kong, and the National University of Singapore have received a total of HK$50 million donation from GS Charity Foundation, the philanthropic arm of the Glorious Sun Group. This contribution is intended to support academic research and talent cultivation in pure mathematics over the next five years. The ‚ÄúGlorious Sun Postdoc Research Scheme‚Äù and ‚ÄúGlorious Sun Visiting Scholar Scheme‚Äù will be launched following the signing of the agreement. The former will enable the annual recruitment of two postdoctoral students for each university, supporting their progression to full-time research or teaching positions while engaging in ongoing research in pure mathematics. The latter initiative will back the four institutions in tackling the world‚Äôs unresolved mathematical mysteries in partnership with mainland and overseas mathematicians through short-term visits or collaborations funded by the scheme. Additionally, each university is encouraged to host or co-host at least two academic conferences every year to promote knowledge exchange amongst local, mainland and international scholars. Details: https://bit.ly/3WLRisY #CUHK #TheChineseUniversityofHongKong #CUHKResearch #ResearchExcellence #PureMathematics
